name: Apartheid Museum
address: Northern Parkway, Ormonde, Johannesburg, 2091, South Africa
description: The Apartheid Museum is one of the most important cultural attractions in South Africa, providing deep insights into the country's history during the apartheid era and its fight for freedom.

name: Nelson Mandela Square
address: 1 Maude St, Sandown, Sandton, Johannesburg, 2146, South Africa
description: A major public space in Sandton, Johannesburg, Nelson Mandela Square is known for its giant statue of Nelson Mandela, surrounded by shops, restaurants, and a vibrant atmosphere.

name: Botanical Gardens
address: Olifants Rd, Emmarentia, Johannesburg, 2195, South Africa
description: This expansive and peaceful botanical garden is perfect for a relaxing day out, featuring beautiful landscapes, lush lawns and colourful flowers, a bird sanctuary, and the renowned Emmarentia Dam.

name: Gold Reef City
address: Cnr Data Crescent & Northern Parkway, Ormonde, Johannesburg, 2131, South Africa
description: Gold Reef City is an exciting amusement park and theme park situated on an old gold mine. It offers thrilling rides, a casino, and historical exhibitions related to Johannesburg's gold mining history.

name: Constitution Hill
address: 11 Kotze Street, Braamfontein, Johannesburg, 2017, South Africa
description: Constitution Hill is home to the Constitutional Court and is significant in South Africa's journey to democracy. The site includes former prison cells and exhibitions on South Africa's struggle for justice and freedom.

name: Maboneng Precinct
address: 286 Fox St, City and Suburban, Johannesburg, 2000, South Africa
description: Maboneng is a trendy neighborhood in Johannesburg known for its vibrant arts scene, unique shops, street food, and galleries. It's a hub for urban creatives and a great place for cultural exploration.

name: Lion Park
description: The Lion Park is a popular wildlife reserve offering a close-up experience with lions, as well as other wildlife such as giraffes, zebras, and hyenas. It's perfect for families looking to experience South Africa's wildlife.

name: Soweto
description: Soweto is a vibrant township famous for its history, particularly its role in the struggle against apartheid. Key landmarks include the home of Nelson Mandela (now a museum), the Hector Pieterson Memorial, and Vilakazi Street.
